column4: On the post https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetAndNetworking/DualHomedGatewayDHCP it tells me At shell prompt, issue ifdown eth2 command, i dont understand what they are asking
do you have a terminal open?
yes
type that ifdown eth2 in the terminal
ok, thank you, if you look at the post im trying to setup 2 internet connections, the only problem is that the other connecting is via usb(its my phone) can i just replace eth2 with the usb location?
what does the output of ifconfig give you?
to answer your question though, no, a network interface name is required
can i paste here? so do you know how i can do this with a connection via usb and via eth0?
if you put the ifconfig information in the pastebin, I'll take a look at it and try and help you
ok but when i try paste is says im spamming and i must enable javascript :s
that's weird - can you turn java script on?
I guess they're assuming that bots don't have javascript, and people do? I don't know
please can i just paste it to you in private chat
sure, go right ahead
thanks :)
you have any luck w/ your cell phone problem?
im having other problems now, sometimes when i boot up my hdds dont seem to auto mount... is this a normal?
if your hdds have filesystem errors, they won't mount (check with fsck)
fsck?
fsck when run from a terminal will check disks for filesystem errors, ie fsck /dev/sda1
i get: fsck: fsck.ntfs: not found, that cant be good :s
you probably want to use windows to check ntfs disks
yeah ok, ill be back later then, thanks :)
